docs.snippet: LEAD: For some time, residents of the Bankhead Courts public housing project here suffered in silence from the brisk, open and frequently violent drug trade in their midst. Then last month an innocent letter carrier found himself in the middle of ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For some time, residents of the Bankhead Courts public housing project here suffered in silence from the brisk, open and frequently violent drug trade in their midst. Then last month an innocent letter carrier found himself in the middle of a drug deal gone bad, and the Postal Service cut off the mail to the 500 apartments.

headline.main: Atlanta Journal; Loss of Mail Jolts Tenants Into Action
